column4: Nozorro: It's a hard disk, it's device is /dev/sda, and the speed is unavailable
Nozorro: Ubuntu and other info are in diff partitions
Noz/Var: The info from windows is in the NTFS partition, that's the stuff I want to read.
Nozorro: mount: /dev/sda already mounted or /mnt busy
mount: according to mtab, /dev/sda1 is mounted on /tmp/disks-conf-sda1
what does, "ls /tmn/disks-conf-sda1" say?  Also, does /etc/mtab mention it?  It may actually be mounted
*** how about "sudo ls /tmp/disks-conf-sda1"?  Same typo AGAIN
I'm not sure, I wasn't here to see what your original question was >_>
that means that /etc/apt/sources.list contains a line that has the word "sudo" in it, which shouldn't be there.  Edit your /etc/apt/sources.list and delete Sudo out of line 34.
nano /etc/apt/sources.list  then from there go to line 34, delete sudo, press control+x, choose yes to save, then run apt-get update.
or rather SUDO nano /etc/apt/sources.list  (i am not an ubuntu user <_<)
